definition: front/forward/ahead/first/top (followed by a number)/future/ago/before/BC (e.g. 前293年)/former/formerly

sentences.english: Iwill give you a call after I contact the Front Office about the rollaway.
sentences.chinese: 我与前厅部联系您家创的有关事宜后马上给你回电话。

sentences.english: As he was in the hall I could not go into the front parlour and lie at the window.
sentences.chinese: 因为他在走廊里，所以我没法走到前厅靠着窗户躺下。

sentences.english: Infm the Front Office Manger Manger on Duty Security immediately of lost items.
sentences.chinese: 遗失物品通知前厅经理或值班经理和保安部。

sentences.english: She put the book in the front room on top of the family Bible.
sentences.chinese: 她把那书放在前厅的家用圣经上。

sentences.english: We took the lift to the lobby and heard bangs as the door opened.
sentences.chinese: 我们坐电梯到了前厅，门打开的时候听到砰砰的声音。

sentences.english: A small anteroom was almost completely dominated by a Ping-Pong table.
sentences.chinese: 一个小小的前厅几乎被一张乒乓球桌占满。

sentences.english: Compile statistics for front office and provide reports relating to that area.
sentences.chinese: 为前厅部整编统计数字并提供与之相关的报告。

sentences.english: This ensures sunlight entry directly into the forecourt.
sentences.chinese: 这样确定阳光能直接进入前厅。

sentences.english: Prepare the recapitulation of all Front Office and Outlet Transactions accurately and timely.
sentences.chinese: 确保及时准确地提供前厅和餐厅业务的报表。

sentences.english: From the ante-room they walked into another room.
sentences.chinese: 他们从前厅走进另一个房间。

sentences.english: She motioned us through the reception area toward a sitting - room.
sentences.chinese: 她做手势让我们穿过接待前厅走向起居室。

sentences.english: Next day, when returning from the living room, he shook head and signed again.
sentences.chinese: 到了第二天，自前厅见客回来，还是一样的摇头叹息。

sentences.english: He had been patiently waiting in the anteroom for an hour.
sentences.chinese: 他在前厅耐心地等了一个小时。

sentences.english: Bell Captain, Concierge, Front Office Manager.
sentences.chinese: 行李领班，礼宾主管，前厅部经理。

sentences.english: Take these flowers into the ante room or dressing- room , " said the viscount".
sentences.chinese: “把这些花搬到前厅更衣室去，”子爵说。

sentences.english: Submit all no-show folios to the Front Office Manager for approval.
sentences.chinese: 将所有的预订未到账目呈交给前厅部经理以便确认。

definition: reception pavilion (generally part of a large residence, and often built in a garden)
customer area of a store/showroom/dining area of a restaurant
private room (in a restaurant, bath house, etc)
central room of a traditional Chinese house
